channel.title: Docker.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Docker.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Secure by Design: A Shift-Left Approach with Testcontainers, Docker Scout, and Hardened Images
item.description: In today’s fast-paced world of software development, product teams are expected to move quickly: building features, shipping updates, and reacting to user needs in real-time. But moving fast should never mean compromising on quality or security. Thanks to modern tooling, developers can now maintain high standards while accelerating delivery. In a previous article, we explored... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/a-shift-left-approach-with-docker/

item.title: Docker Desktop Accelerates Innovation with Faster Release Cadence
item.description: We're excited to announce a major evolution in how we deliver Docker Desktop updates to you. Starting with Docker Desktop release 4.45.0 on 28 August we're moving to releases every two weeks, with the goal of reaching weekly releases by the end of 2025. Why We're Making This Change You've told us you want faster... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/docker-desktop-updates-every-two-weeks/

item.title: Prototyping an AI Tutor with Docker Model Runner
item.description: Every developer remembers their first docker run hello-world. The mix of excitement and wonder as that simple command pulls an image, creates a container, and displays a friendly message. But what if AI could make that experience even better? As a technical writer on Docker’s Docs team, I spend my days thinking about developer experience.... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/how-to-build-an-ai-tutor-with-model-runner/
